summary: The Keep Kids Covered Act (S. 2496) amends the Social Security Act to provide continuous eligibility for children under Medicaid and CHIP. Key provisions include extending continuous eligibility for newborns to age 6, continuous eligibility for children under 19 and former foster youth, and requiring states to update contact information for enrolled individuals. The bill also adjusts the application of the provision providing coverage continuity for former foster children up to age 26 under Medicaid.
